summary: This document consists of email correspondence from August 10, 2019, discussing discrepancies in inmate count slips at a detention facility, specifically questioning why the count changed from 73 to 72 between midnight and 3am. The emails are marked as confidential and appear to be part of an internal inquiry or investigation.

events.title: Inmate Count Discrepancy Inquiry
events.description: Internal email correspondence questioning a discrepancy in inmate count slips at a detention facility, where the count changed from 73 to 72 between midnight and 3am.

keyFacts: The document reveals an internal inquiry into inmate count discrepancies at a detention facility on August 10, 2019.
The count reportedly changed from 73 to 72 between 12am and 3am, raising questions about accuracy.
The correspondence is marked as confidential and appears to be part of official records (SDNY_00010225, EFTA00123174).
The emails were sent from a Verizon Samsung Galaxy smartphone, indicating mobile communication.
The document suggests potential procedural issues or record-keeping concerns at the facility.
